hero.title: EU Family Reunification in Sweden
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive Support for EU Citizens and Their Families

intro.heading: Bring Your EU Family to Sweden
intro.description: Relocating to Sweden as an EU citizen gives you the legal right to bring your family with you, ensuring your loved ones can join you and enjoy Sweden's quality of life, healthcare, education, and social benefits. Sweden Relocators provides expert support for EU family reunification, covering eligibility, documentation, residence cards, personnummer registration, housing, and integration.
intro.infoBox: EU family reunification in Sweden is based on Directive 2004/38/EC, allowing EU citizens living in Sweden to bring family members and access healthcare, education, and social benefits on the same terms as other residents.

whatIs.heading: What is EU Family Reunification?
whatIs.description: EU family reunification in Sweden is based on Directive 2004/38/EC on the right of EU citizens and their families to move and reside freely within the EU. It allows EU citizens living in Sweden to bring family members with them, whether immediate or extended family, as long as certain conditions are met.

euCitizensRelocation.immediateFamilyHeading: Immediate Family Members Eligible for Reunification

immediateFamily.description: Includes both opposite-sex and same-sex marriages and registered partnerships recognized under Swedish law.
If the relationship is long-term and recognized as equivalent to marriage in Sweden.
Biological or adopted children of the EU citizen or their spouse/partner.
If they rely financially on the EU citizen.
Relatives in the ascending line who are financially dependent.

extendedFamily.heading: Extended Family Members and Dependency
extendedFamily.description: In some cases, extended family members may also qualify if dependency can be proven. This can include adult siblings, adult children living in the same household, and other relatives with strong dependency ties. Eligibility for extended family reunification is stricter and requires clear evidence of dependency.

longTermPermitRequirements: Hold a valid long-term residence permit issued by another EU state
Have sufficient financial means and housing in Sweden
Apply for residence in Sweden together with their immediate family members

residenceCard.heading: Residence Card for Family Members
residenceCard.intro: Family members who plan to stay in Sweden for more than three months must apply for a Residence Card with Migrationsverket (the Swedish Migration Agency).
documents: Proof of family relationship (marriage certificate, registered partnership certificate, or birth certificate)
Proof of dependency (for parents, grandparents, or children over 21)
Proof of residence in Sweden by the EU citizen (rental agreement, property ownership, or employment contract)
Financial proof that the EU citizen can support themselves and their family
residenceCard.note: Residence cards are usually valid for five years or for as long as the EU citizen is living in Sweden.

personnummer.heading: Personnummer (Swedish Personal Identity Number)
personnummer.intro: Once family members receive a residence card, they must register with Skatteverket (Swedish Tax Agency) to obtain a personnummer. This number is essential for:

healthcare.heading: Healthcare and Health Insurance
healthcare.description: Family members can access Sweden's public healthcare system once they have a personnummer. Until then, private health insurance is required. For non-EU family members, comprehensive health insurance covering at least EUR 30,000 is recommended.

programs.name: Compulsory Education
programs.description: Free schooling for children aged 6–16, including meals

programs.name: Preschool (Förskola)
programs.description: Available for children aged 1–5, with subsidized fees

programs.name: International Schools
programs.description: Options for families seeking education in English or other languages

bankAccounts.heading: Bank Accounts and Financial Integration
bankAccounts.intro: After obtaining a personnummer, family members can open a Swedish bank account. Required documents often include:
bankAccounts.note: Bank accounts allow access to digital payments, online banking, and Swish (Sweden's mobile payment system).

language.heading: Language and Integration Support
language.description: Learning Swedish is crucial for integration. Family members can join SFI (Swedish for Immigrants) courses once they are registered with a personnummer. These free, government-funded courses improve daily communication and employment opportunities. Sweden Relocators also offers cultural orientation services to help families adapt faster.

applicationProcess.title: Assessment of Eligibility
applicationProcess.description: Sweden Relocators checks if family members qualify under EU rules.

applicationProcess.title: Follow-Up and Communication
applicationProcess.description: Handling any requests from the Migration Agency.

applicationProcess.title: Registration with Skatteverket
applicationProcess.description: Assistance with personnummer, ID card, and tax registration.

applicationProcess.title: Integration Services
applicationProcess.description: Housing, schools, healthcare, and language support.

services.heading: How Sweden Relocators Supports Families
services.description: Our comprehensive services and digital portal ensure your family reunification is smooth, compliant, and stress-free.

servicesList.title: Eligibility Checks and Legal Assessments
servicesList.description: We verify that your family members qualify under EU regulations.

servicesList.title: Document Preparation and Certified Translations
servicesList.description: All documents are professionally prepared and translated for Swedish authorities.

servicesList.title: Application Submission and Tracking
servicesList.description: We submit applications and monitor progress with Migrationsverket.

servicesList.title: Appeals Support
servicesList.description: If applications are denied, we provide full support through the appeals process.

servicesList.title: Housing and School Search
servicesList.description: We assist with finding suitable accommodation and enrolling children in schools.

servicesList.title: Insurance and Healthcare Support
servicesList.description: Guidance on Swedish healthcare access and insurance requirements.

whySweden.title: Strong Social Welfare System
whySweden.description: Access to comprehensive healthcare, education, and social security benefits.

whySweden.title: Free Education and Healthcare
whySweden.description: World-class education and healthcare services available to all residents.

whySweden.title: Safe and Family-Friendly
whySweden.description: Sweden offers a secure, inclusive, and high-quality environment for families.

whySweden.title: Secure Residency Rights
whySweden.description: Legal protection under both EU and Swedish immigration laws.

cta.heading: Ready to Start Your EU Family Reunification Journey?
cta.description: Sweden Relocators is here to ensure your transition is smooth, compliant, and stress-free. Contact us today to begin your family reunification journey. Our digital portal allows families to manage profiles, upload documents, and track progress in real time.
cta.subtext: Our expert team will guide your family through every step of the EU family reunification process in Sweden.
